Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region

    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane

      Piece(boolean isWhiteIn, Tile tileIn)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calcAvaliableMoves()
      Calculates the avaliable moves for a piece (utilizes access to board through tile game attribute) Clear avaliable moves Calculate pinned whiteList Access whiteLists from Board through Game If not King and piece is Pinned and tiles attacking king less than 1 calculate moves with pinned whiteList else If not King and tiles attacking king equals 1 and piece is not Pinned calculate moves with attacking king whiteList else If tiles attacking king is empty or is piece is King calculate moves without whiteList
      abstract java.util.ArrayList<int[]> calcCommonPieceLocations(int[] location)
      Calculates and returns a list of any other pieces of the same type that can move to the same location on the board

      Calculates the distance between 0 and a position
      protected void doRender()
      Performs rendering of Selectable to the Game GUI the piece belongs to Establishes closable Un-selects selectable from Game Selects this tile in Game Render selectable based on Game ready position

      Game getController()

      boolean isCloseable() 
      boolean isKing() 
      boolean isKnight() 
      boolean isPawn() 
      boolean isPinned(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> whiteList, Piece king)
      Calculates the whiteListed tiles if a piece is pinned to ally King to an ArrayList, and returns whether the piece is pinned Algorithm is terminated upon 3 conditions: This piece is a king (returns false as King cannot be pinned to itself) The vector between the king and this piece cannot be normalized (there is no diagonal or horizontal trajectory) If Neither is true, King loops through each tile following the normalized trajectory between itself and this piece until it reaches a potential pinning piece or the bounds of the board while add adding each tile to the WhiteList (a pinned piece may move between pinning piece and King and remain pinned) If a potential pinning piece is reached the piece pins if only 2 pieces (itself and this piece) are found from the King to itself and it has attacking trajectory to the King (such as horizontal for a Rook) Algorithm terminates and returns whether or not a pin was found
      boolean isQueen() 
      boolean isRook() 
      boolean isWhite() 
      void moveTo(Tile tile)
      Move a piece to a tile (intended to be used behind the scenes)
      void moveToSlowly(Tile tile)
      Move to piece to a tile with GUI delay (intended for user to see)
      int normalize(int num)
      Normalizes a value direction within the context of Chess to be quantifiable into the basic system of Rows and Columns.
      boolean normalizeable(int row, int col)
      Returns whether or not a value can be normalized with Piece::normalize
      abstract void pieceAvaliableMoves()
      Calculates the avaliable moves a piece can make on its Game Board and adds them to attributes
      abstract void pieceAvaliableMoves(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> whiteListed)
      Calculates the avaliable moves a piece can make on its Game Board and adds them to attributes Adds the additional functionality over Piece::pieceAvaliableMoves by checking if the tiles are within the whiteList

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<int[]> calcCommonPieceLocations(int[] location)

        Returns:

      • pieceAvaliableMoves

        public abstract void pieceAvaliableMoves(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> whiteListed)
        Calculates the avaliable moves a piece can make on its Game Board and adds them to attributes Adds the additional functionality over Piece::pieceAvaliableMoves by checking if the tiles are within the whiteList
        Parameters:
        whiteListed, - whiteList used to filter out moves

      • calcAvaliableMoves

        public void calcAvaliableMoves()
        Calculates the avaliable moves for a piece (utilizes access to board through tile game attribute) Clear avaliable moves Calculate pinned whiteList Access whiteLists from Board through Game If not King and piece is Pinned and tiles attacking king less than 1 calculate moves with pinned whiteList else If not King and tiles attacking king equals 1 and piece is not Pinned calculate moves with attacking king whiteList else If tiles attacking king is empty or is piece is King calculate moves without whiteList

      • isPinned

        public boolean isPinned(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> whiteList,
                        Piece king)
        Calculates the whiteListed tiles if a piece is pinned to ally King to an ArrayList, and returns whether the piece is pinned Algorithm is terminated upon 3 conditions: This piece is a king (returns false as King cannot be pinned to itself) The vector between the king and this piece cannot be normalized (there is no diagonal or horizontal trajectory) If Neither is true, King loops through each tile following the normalized trajectory between itself and this piece until it reaches a potential pinning piece or the bounds of the board while add adding each tile to the WhiteList (a pinned piece may move between pinning piece and King and remain pinned) If a potential pinning piece is reached the piece pins if only 2 pieces (itself and this piece) are found from the King to itself and it has attacking trajectory to the King (such as horizontal for a Rook) Algorithm terminates and returns whether or not a pin was found
        Parameters:
        whiteList, - the whiteList to write to
        king - to compare pin
        Returns:
        whether or not piece is pinned

      • normalizeable

        public boolean normalizeable(int row,
                             int col)
        Returns whether or not a value can be normalized with Piece::normalize
        Parameters:
        row - to be normalized
        col - to be normalized
        Returns:
        true if can be normalized

      • normalize

        public int normalize(int num)
        Normalizes a value direction within the context of Chess to be quantifiable into the basic system of Rows and Columns. If the number is equal to 0, the normalized value is 0. Otherwise it is the number divided by its absolute value, which would retain the sign, specifying the direction of movement.
        Parameters:
        num, - the number to be normalized
        Returns:
        the normalized value

      • whiteListed

        protected boolean whiteListed(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> whitelist,
                              Tile tile)
        Checks if a tile is WhiteListed
        Parameters:
        whitelist - to determine avaliable
        tile - to check
        Returns:
        if a tile is whiteListed, returns true

      • hasLegalMoves

        protected boolean hasLegalMoves()
        Checks if a piece has any legal moves
        Returns:
        true if avaliable move list is not empty
